story.text: (Corrects spelling of Pinault in second paragraph)PARIS Jan 2 (Reuters) - French energy groups Gaz de France GAZ.PA and Suez LYOE.PA on Tuesday stuck to their merger plan in the face of a possible bid by French billionaire Francois Pinault on Suez. A spokeswoman for Gaz de France reitereated a statement by executive chairman Jean-Francois Cirelli that the firm had no common projects with Pinault and that a merger with Suez remained the best strategic solution. A spokesman for Suez said the company's strategy was one of an intergrated company and no activities were for sale. Pinault's investment company Artemis on Tuesday said it had not taken any decision regarding a bid for Suez and was keeping its options open. French newspapers said Pinault could break up Suez after a bid.
